Trial_Design.evidence: Before rating, observers were randomized to a training group (34 observers) and a nontraining group (30 observers).

Intervention.evidence: The training group received an online training module before the rating session, and the nontraining group did not.

Objective.evidence: We tested whether training can improve interobserver reliability and sensitivity, specificity, and accuracy for the diagnosis of scaphoid fracture displacement on radiographs and CT scans.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Before rating, observers were randomized to a training group (34 observers) and a nontraining group (30 observers).

Number_Randomised.evidence: Before rating, observers were randomized to a training group (34 observers) and a nontraining group (30 observers).

Result_Outcome.evidence: The average sensitivity, specificity, and accuracy of diagnosing displacement of scaphoid fractures were, respectively, 83%, 85%, and 84% for the nontraining group and 87%, 86%, and 87% for the training group.
